subject: Re: [junit] Help, can test cases be retrieved from the package they are in?
msgSnippet: Jeff, What do you mean by mass add ? To what are you adding these tests? If it s an IDE or command-line project (built by Ant or Maven), check the build
messageBody:
Jeff,

What do you mean by "mass add"? To what are you adding these tests? If
it's an IDE or command-line project (built by Ant or Maven), check the
build tool's documentation for how to run tests. For example, in Ant,
the <junit> target has a <batchtest> element that allows you to specify
test names using wildcards, such as

<junit>
<batchtest todir="test-logs/">
<fileset dir="test-src/">
<include name="**/*Test*.class"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>

> I'm relatively new but this seam like something that can be done and
> that someone should have done it by now, or am I way off on this
> thought.
>
> I have been give around 160 separate unit test files, instead of
> listing them one line at a time.
> Is there a way I can grab them from the package directory and do a
> mass add of the test cases at run time?
>

> all the testcases are in the same package.
> (package com.thc.ids.application.hcs.test.CalculatorTest.tests;)
